column4: hello - looking for some help with resizing a Linux partition without bringing down the OS. Can anyone point me in the right direction please
but it depends on how you parititioned your disk
inside the box, do you use lvm or not?
if your partition is in the middle, you are mostly out of luck
if you had it as the last partition, you could expand it with fdisk; with lvm you could add separate disks instead of growing an existing one, too
you can actually do it afterwards too, but a bit tinkering
also I suggest for these questions you could go to ubuntu-server ;)
hmm acutally if you did not use any swap
... if you didnt use any swap, or the extended, you could turn off swap and increase the partition 1,
then add another disk for swap
and consider using lvm on any new installations ;)
Hehe I think especially in my VM's it's proabably a good idea
well lvm is even better on physical harddisks, can move from one disk to another on the fly effortlessly!
